lead_paragraph: A blanket of snow now covers the bloody battlefields of Russia from the Arctic to Rostov-on-the-Don. Rostov is almost 800 miles south of Leningrad, where the cold is already bitter. The air around Moscow is sharp and frosty. The roads have hardened, but are choked with snow.
